intro: Tetrameranthus guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan tetrameranthus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, with five petals and numerous stamens, making it visually striking. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests.
